charm_xnum¶

Module to work with X-numbers after Fukushima (2012).

Note

This documentation is written for double precision version of CHarm.

References:

  • Fukushima, T. (2012) Numerical computation of spherical harmonics of arbitrary degree and order by extending exponent of floating point numbers. Journal of Geodesy 86:271-285.

Functions

void charm_xnum_xnorm(double *x, int *ix)¶

Weakly normalizes an X-number. The function is due to Fukushima (2012), Table 7.

Parameters

  • x – [in] Pointer to the significand of the input X-number

  • ix – [in] Pointer to the exponent of the input X-number

  • x – [out] Pointer to the significand of the output X-number

  • ix – [out] Pointer to the exponent of the output X-number

void charm_xnum_xlsum2(double f, double x, double g, double y, double *z, int ix, int iy, int *iz)¶

Computes a two-term linear sum of X-numbers with F-number coefficients. The function is due to Fukushima (2012), Table 8.

Parameters

  • f – [in] F-number coefficient of the first linear term

  • x – [in] Significand of the first X-number term

  • g – [in] F-number coefficient of the second linear term

  • y – [in] Significand of the second X-number term

  • ix – [in] Exponent of the first X-number term

  • iy – [in] Exponent of the second X-number term

  • z – [out] Pointer to the significand of the output X-number

  • iz – [out] Pointer to the exponent of the output X-number

double charm_xnum_x2f(double x, int ix)¶

Translates an X-number into an F-number. The function is due to Fukushima (2012), Table 6.

Parameters

  • x – [in] Significand of the X-number

  • ix – [in] Exponent of the X-number

Returns

The F-number representation of an input X-number.
